direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 3)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In each step, the symbols move in the sequenceand the symbol that reaches the encircled position gets replaced by a new one.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 3)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In one step, all the elements get vertically inverted and interchange positions in the sequence. In the next step, the elements interchange positions in the sequenceand the third element gets vertically inverted.

answer_description: We can label the arcs as shown. The arcs get inverted in the sequence (1 & 2), (3, 4 & 5), (6 & 1), (2, 3 & 4), (5 & 6),...........

answer_description: In each step, all the symbols move in the sequence

answer_description: The elements move in the sequencesandalternately. Also, in each step, the element that reaches the encircled position, gets replaced by a new element.

question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: We shall assign numbers to the pins as :. Then, in each step, the pins at positions 1,3 and 5 rotate 90oCW while the pins at positions 2,4 and 6 rotate 90oACW. Also, in each step, a new pin is added to the figure and its orientations are the same as that of the pin in fig. (A).

answer_description: One dot and one line segment are added to the figure in each step, once to the LHS and next to the RHS part of the figure.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 4 - 9)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. answer_description: If we label the four elements in the figure as; then the arrow at position 1-rotates 45oACW and 135oACW alternately; the element at position 2 rotates 90oACW and moves to position 3 in each step; the element at position 3 rotates 90oACW and moves to position 4 in each step and the element at position 4 moves to position 2 and gets replaced by a new element in each step.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 4 - 9)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The '=' sign moves to the adjacent position in a CW direction in each step. The symbol at the ACW-end position in fig. (A), moves to the adjacent position in an ACW direction in each step and gets replaced by a new symbol in first, third, fifth, ... steps. The symbol at the CW-end position in fig. (A), moves to the adjacent position in an ACW direction in each step and gets replaced by a new symbol in second, fourth, sixth, ... steps.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 10 - 11)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).

answer_description: The figure gets vertically inverted.

answer_description: In all other figures, the two line segments are parallel to each other.
